text_html:
JacobSeated.com

[module=fp_message]

I am Jacob Kristensen, and this is my portfolio.

About

I like to solve problems and create things to make life easier for myself or other people.

Since I was a kid, I have enjoyed building things, and watching them grow. So, one day I would love to either join a startup or build my own company.

This website was created from the ground-up to showcase my work, and to demonstrate my coding-skills. The code for the CMS powering this website is available at GitHub: https://github.com/jacobkri/jacobseated.com under Apache license.

Credits for photos used on the site goes to Christian Mercier (ccmpixart.dk).

Use the top navigation to see examples of things I have made. My Highlighted Projects can be found on the Projects page.

Note. This site is still a work-in-progress, and I may not have included my KEA projects yet. They will likely get their own dedicated page, including information on my design-process, sketches, wireframes and other relevant stuff.

My Superpowers

I have a broad set of skills with a <strong> focus on coding, and most things to do with Web Development. I am also very creative, and I know how to use several different programs for video and photo editing.

Since my main operating system is now Linux (dual boot with Windows), I have learned to use Open Source programs such as: LibreOffice, OBS, Handbrake, Gimp and Kdenlive. But, I am also able to use "industry standard" Adobe CC, including Photoshop, Premiere, Illustrator and InDesign.

I am also familiar with 3D Studio MAX, although I have not used it for many years. However, it has given me a feel with 3D modeling and Animation, which might be useful at some point.

Some years ago, I used to make animated Gifs. But, I have since moved on to animated SVGs using CSS and JavaScript.

When I work, I am usually very independent. I solve problems on my own, and come up with my own solutions. I learned early on to use Google before asking questions. It seems like a good approach. Though sometimes it may be faster to just ask.

The History

I started coding and creating websites as a kid, first using plain notepad in Windows, later moving on to editors with Syntax Highlighting. Now, I mainly use Linux with Eclipse and Visual Studio Code.

January 2013 I decided to seak an unpaid internship for a few months as a Web Developer. Doing this time, I was allowed to improve my existing skills with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP.

In addition, I also learned more about Linux, how to use AWS (Amazon Web Services), Git, and Bootstrap.

It was doing this time I decided to go back to school to get an education. However, first I had to finish high school, which took me a few years. This is required to join higher education in Denmark.

October 2017 I started studying Multimedia Design and Communication at KEA (Copenhagen School of Design and Technology), and expect to complete my education on time.

This education has a broad focus, covering many of my existing interests. Including video editing, marketing, business, SEO and web development.

Where I am going

My plan is to continue sharpening my skills in all aspects of web-development, possibly seeking further education later. But, I am not sure at this point, since I already know a lot of different things, and I am fine learning things on my own.

In fact, I prefer learning things by myself, since I find it to be much faster than traditional education in a classroom. It allows you to focus exactly on the topics you need, and ignore all the irrelevant stuff until it is actually needed.

When I am done with my education, I will likely start looking for a job.
